subject: RE: [junit] The right amount of testing !?

messageBody:
Erik,

> But somehow I started to create similar tests for each action that Ive
> already tested (testing the same problems that I did on the
> action level),
> which means Im sitting with ALOT of testcases that looks the
> same but are
> invoked from different levels. (the action itself is one level, the
> server is on a higher level)
>
>
> What is the "right" amount of testing, is it best to do the
> same test but
> on different levels in order to make sure that NO strange behaviour is
> discovered or should I just test the whole flow?

Maybe mock your actions and test if the http server routes the request
correctly to the corresponding mocked action.

Build the mocks in a way that they can generate all the output/result
which the real object can produce. Test if the http server reacts correctly
to these outputs/results.

Is it possible to refactor you server to extract the functionality
which routes the requests, so you can test it without running the server?

Bernd
